definition: son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: A few of them were going out later that night for drinks.
sentences.chinese: 那天晚上，幾個人喝完酒後就外出找樂子了。

sentences.english: The first day is really lively, all the people go out for fun.
sentences.chinese: 第一天確實很熱鬧，所有的人都出來尋找樂子。

sentences.english: While in the middle of writing a book, I have a hard time reading other books for pleasure.
sentences.chinese: 在寫書的時候，我得苦讀些別的書才能找點樂子。

sentences.english: If you look at your horoscope at all it’s likely for fun.
sentences.chinese: 你關注自己的星座，可能只是爲了找個樂子。

sentences.english: You don’t read an encyclopedia for fun. We’re trying to write a novel.
sentences.chinese: 讀維基百科是找不到樂子的，我們想寫的是小說。

sentences.english: The gardener's little son and his playfellow had come into the hothouse, and, seeing the beetle, wanted to have some fun with him.
sentences.chinese: 園丁的小兒子和夥伴看到了他就決定要找點樂子。

sentences.english: In other words, they're the most likely to use the net for fun.
sentences.chinese: 換句話來說，他們更喜歡用網絡找樂子。

sentences.english: It's always fun to hang out.
sentences.chinese: 我們倆一起出去玩，總是有很多樂子。

sentences.english: It's been years since I waded through sewers for fun.
sentences.chinese: 我上次在下水道找樂子是好幾年的事了。

sentences.english: Your primary concern will probably be having fun right now.
sentences.chinese: 你現在首要關心的可能只是開心和找樂子。

sentences.english: They might have a lot more fun, invent better games than we ever did.
sentences.chinese: 它們也許會過得快活的多，找出更好玩的樂子。

sentences.english: I know that you‘ve both had a lot of fun these last two years on the campaign trail.
sentences.chinese: 我知道這兩年你們倆隨我一路競選都有過不少樂子。

sentences.english: The recreational user just likes gliding around for fun or to do chores.
sentences.chinese: 第二種是休閒使用者，只是喜歡兜風找樂子。

sentences.english: He exploded the gunpowder for fun but it caused the fire.
sentences.chinese: 他爆炸火藥找樂子，卻造成了大火。

sentences.english: If you want to enjoy yourself, clap your hands.
sentences.chinese: 如果你想找點樂子，就拍拍手。

sentences.english: A: After five days' hard work, I'm surely going to have some fun.
sentences.chinese: 辛苦工作了五天，我當然要去找些樂子。

definition: to find amusement in one's own way/to enjoy oneself quietly
to have spare time/free from work/it's not important/it's nothing/never mind
to live one's life/to pass one's days/to get along
to play/to have fun/to hang out
to live alone/to spend time alone (or with a significant other)
to relieve boredom or melancholy/a diversion
billowing smoke (idiom)/foul atmosphere/(fig.) murky atmosphere/in a turmoil
